Entities.Name: Patient
Entities.Definition: Represents the person receiving care. Includes attributes like age, gender, marital status.

Entities.Name: Diagnosis
Entities.Definition: Conditions or diseases diagnosed by the physician.

Entities.Name: Findings
Entities.Definition: Clinical findings including symptoms, vital signs, allergies, immunizations, and social history.

Entities.Name: Medications
Entities.Definition: Pharmacological treatments including drug names and dosage forms.

Entities.Name: DiagnosticTests
Entities.Definition: Diagnostic assessments including laboratory and radiology procedures.

Entities.Name: Procedures
Entities.Definition: Therapeutic or diagnostic actions such as surgeries or biopsies.

Entities.Name: Drug Attributes
Entities.Definition: Details related to drug administration such as dosage, frequency, and timing.

Entities.Name: VitalSigns
Entities.Definition: Measurements related to physical health such as temperature and blood pressure.

Entities.Name: History
Entities.Definition: Historical data including condition onset or previous illnesses.

Entities.Name: Examination
Entities.Definition: Physical assessment results including body site and condition.

Dataset.Name: OB-CIE Clinical Note Corpus
Dataset.Description: 150 handwritten clinical documents from five specialties (internal medicine, surgery, gynecology, pulmonology, pediatrics) representing 847 physician notes and 3165 concepts.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Entity recognition was performed using a dictionary built from a domain ontology (PCD) based on SPARQL queries and UMLS mapping. Manual review by domain experts validated concepts and relationships. Attribute values (e.g., '600mg') were also linked to semantic categories like 'Dose'.
